content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md)
    extracted_codes = split(String(md), "\n\n"), "\n\n")
    
    cleaned_codes = map(code -> replace(code, "```\n", ""), "```", "")), extracted_codes
    
    joined_codes = join(cleaned_codes, "\n")) + "\n"
    
    return joined_codes
end
```
The `extract_julia_code` function takes a markdown document (`md`) as input. It first splits the Markdown into separate code blocks using triple backticks (```).

Then it removes the code fences by replacing them with an empty string.

After cleaning, the code blocks are joined together with a newline character.

Finally, the function returns the joined and cleaned Julia code as a String.
